item.title: Bike locked to signpost derelict and falling across well-used path, 28th September
item.description:
This bicycle has been locked to the signpost for a long time and is now falling apart. It often is angled in such a way to lay across a path in daily use by elderly folk and young children, and represents a hazard. Please can someone cut the lock and remove it? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St John's Park, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement damage and unsafe, 28th September
item.description:
As reported many times before the pavement along cray avenue is being damaged by cars and vans using it as a road you say you’re contractor has been informed but nothing has been done to rectify the problems it is only a matter of time before someone is injured on the loose and sticking up slabs or falls down the hole and breaks a leg please do something about this problem and don’t keep passing the buck
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cray Avenue, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Cleaning 155 to 163 Old Brompton Road, 28th September
item.description:
The pavement gets very dirty due to the high foot traffic in this area. Although we clean it daily, it still becomes soiled quickly. Could you please add this pavement to a regular schedule for pressure washing or deep cleaning?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 155-157, Old Brompton Road, South Kensington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Seems to be a reoccurring situation with offensive graffiti, 28th September
item.description:
This lovely cut through has again been ruined with graffiti. Unfortunately this well maintained lane by the neighbours are being destroyed by small minded people… It is worrying how a regular thing happens with no police follow up … The initials are still believed to be an abbreviation to a racial slur which was the same as last time…the last incident was only a few weeks ago on 03/09/2025 . There needs to be a more permanent solution or camera as a deterrent on the light, especially coming round to longer nights, it does get very dark for a family / kids cut through on the way to schools.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Robin Hood Lane, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
